In the working prototype https://zulip-compose.vladkorobov.repl.co/ max-width: 200px;
and for medium breakpoint (like tablet)

@media (max-width: 940px)
.compose-to__stream {
    max-width: 128px;
}

and for mobile breakpoint it takes the whole available width:

@media (max-width: 640px)
.compose-to__stream {
    width: 100%;
    max-width: unset;
}
Do you never want it more than 128px wide? @Vlad Korobov
In that particular size of screen yes
Bigger than tablet sizes it becomes 200px max
Yeah I was specifically asking about biggee than tablet
Thanks!
image.png
Ah okay! Sorry for missing that :)

@Alya Abbott do you want this smaller screen version to be part of this PR? image.png -- my take is it would be better to do after, since it touches other parts of the compose box, whereas my PR currently is just swapping out one thing for another
Yeah, I think as long as the PR is not a regression for small screen sizes, it can be a follow-up.

OK, we've merged #23355 since I think the remaining known issues are pretty minor and will be easier to manage as small PRs on top of this. We have the following follow-up issues:

  • Fix handling of new compose box stream input in low height screens #25217. This is likely somewhat tricky; @Evy
  • Improve compose box UI for streams where user doesn't have posting permissions #25219. @Daniil Fadeev @Sahil Batra do either of you have time to complete this be EOD Monday?
  • New compose box stream picker doesn't clear filter state when closing #25218. This is likely quite straightforward; anyone should feel free to pick it up (but don't claim the issue unless you've actually figured out what you need to do).
I picked up #25218 (clear filter state for stream picker) and opened a quick PR to fix it #25221.

Hm, I guess in #21896 we had decided that a banner didn't seem necessary if we are going to disable the "Send" button in any case. (Thanks Joseph Ho for linking to it!) I'm currently thinking the banner will feel helpful, since it's a pretty unexpected situation and it'll make what's going on clear upfront, but feedback is appreciated.

I have some release-related issues on my plate that are preventing me from moving this up in the queue. I will try to do it, but I'm not sure if I'll be able to complete it by EOD Monday. @Sahil Batra, what are your thoughts on this?
I think, I will be able to do it.

I personally think it's better to keep the banner as it still provides valuable information. If we were to let the user know that they can't post in the stream, I think putting the banner up would be a good first line of warning and notifying the users about it. Preventing the users from further typing into the compose box, which is pretty much what RolandK wants as well.

In #21896, we want to remove the banner and rely heavily on the "send" button state and it's tooltip to convey the situation. But I feel like some users might not even notice the state of the send button as it is a small button in the bottom right corner. Thus, the user might have something typed up before noticing that they can't send.
Ok, cool, I changed #21896 to just be for DMs, and updated the design described there. We'll use #25219 for the stream addressee part.
